text:
POD#1 L thoracotomy, T6-T8 corpectomy, anterior cage with EBL800ml
   POD##15 Fusion T2-L1 lami, IVC filter, CT R and L for abcess
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   New area of skin breakdown beneath left pannis (abd)
   Action:
   Area cleansed with commercial wound cleanser and size documented in
   metavision, mepilex applied
   see NCP and metavision for details
   Response:
   Pt tolerated cleansing and dsg application
   Plan:
   see plan of care
   mepilex dsg reapply PRN
   Document changes in size/healing
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Pt remains intubated post-op on propofol gtt for and Dilaudid 2 mg IVP
   q 3hrs PRN for pain.
   ET-Tube suctioned for small to moderate amounts of very thick yellow
   secretions.
   Scattered rhronchi in all lung fields
   Action:
   ET-tube retapped by resp therapist
   Vent weaned down to 40% FIO2.
   Response:
   Breath sounds improve with suctioning
   ABGs 7.50 48 117 12 39
   Plan:
   Wean to extubated after bronch by Thorasic team today
   .H/O diabetes Mellitus (DM), Type II
   Assessment:
   Hyperglycemic 260, 257
   Action:
   Insulin gtt restarted at 3 units at 0230,
   Response:
   Blood sugar 177
   Plan:
   Insulin calculator used to titrate appropriate dose, insulin gtt at 1
   unit/hr at 0430
   Continue to check BS and titrate insulin q 1 hr.
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Pt using hand signal like she was pressing her PCA button and shook
   head yes that she was in pain.
   Pt ,s PCA was d/c
d in OR and not appropriate treatment while pt
   intubated on propofol
   Unable to scale pain level
   propofol on 50mcg/kg/min for sedation while intubated
   Action:
   Dilaudid 2 mg IVP q 3 hrs PRN
   Response:
   Pt nods head yes that pain is tolerable
   Plan:
   Continue to assess and treat post-op pain
   Follow NCP interventions.
   Sepsis without organ dysfunction
   Assessment:
   MRSA operaitve sites, low grade temps, WBC 22.2
   Action:
   Vanco 1000mg IVP q 12 hrs
   Response:
   Continues with low grade fevers
   Plan:
   Continue medical treatment as ordered
